title: Issue 308
summary: Communities, WWDC Notes, and a Weekly Xamarin App.

items.description:
It's almost the weekend and that means it's time for the Weekly Xamarin newsletter.

As always lots of great articles for the week. I particularly like the WWDC roundup and the List of World Wide Xamarin & MAUI communities that Luis Matos has curated.

We are also pleased to announce we now have a Weekly Xamarin App. It's a little rough around the edges, but hope you find it useful. Check it out here.

Thanks to the wonderful people who have made this happen: Lachlan Gordon, Luce Carter, Ryan Davis, David Wahid, James Montemagno, Aden Earnshaw, Sameer Mansoor and Jonathan Parker (and many others who have watched the streams of us building it). If you want to contribute and help build it out further we accept pull requests ;-)

Have a great weekend everyone.

❤

Kym
items.description_markdown:
It's almost the weekend and that means it's time for the Weekly Xamarin newsletter. 

As always lots of great articles for the week. I particularly like the WWDC roundup and the List of World 
 Wide Xamarin & MAUI communities that Luis Matos has curated. 

We are also pleased to announce we now have a Weekly Xamarin App.  It's a little rough around the edges, but hope you find it useful.  [Check it out here.](https://weeklyxamarin.github.io/website/)

Thanks to the wonderful people who have made this happen: Lachlan Gordon, Luce Carter, Ryan Davis, David Wahid, James Montemagno, Aden Earnshaw, Sameer Mansoor and Jonathan Parker (and many others who have watched the streams of us building it).  If you want to contribute and help build it out further we accept pull requests ;-)

Have a great weekend everyone.

❤

Kym

items.title: Simple way to use Maps
items.description:
Maps are very useful in our applications, they allow us to display in a graphic way the location of the desired place - and it's super simple with just a few lines of code.

items.title: Tune in, Log out.
items.description:

items.title: Getting Started with Dependency Injection in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
What do you do when you want to create testable code or when you need to access native features? You need an interface to implement! Then you need a way to inject that implementation (dependency) to access it from your shared code (or anywhere). You will do this pretty often with mobile application development and luckily for us Xamarin.Forms has it all built in! Today' we take a look at Dependency Injection for Xamarin.Forms to create testable services and also access native features.

Getting Started with Dependency Injection in Xamarin.Forms by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
What do you do when you want to create testable code or when you need to access native features? You need an interface to implement! Then you need a way to inject that implementation (dependency) to access it from your shared code (or anywhere). You will do this pretty often with mobile application development and luckily for us Xamarin.Forms has it all built in! Today' we take a look at Dependency Injection for Xamarin.Forms to create testable services and also access native features.

[**Getting Started with Dependency Injection in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6CwQKqMpUFk) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/niners/jamesmontemagno)

embedded_links.title: **Getting Started with Dependency Injection in Xamarin.Forms**

items.title: Setup Maps in Your Xamarin.Forms Apps
items.description:
Learn how to add Xamarin.Forms.Maps to your app and use maps in your Xamarin.Forms app! In this video we will see how to add a map to your iOS and Android app. We will add permissions, API keys and all the things that are needed to show that map on screen.

I know there were request for other things with maps, let me know in the comments what you'd like to see next!

Setup Maps in Your Xamarin.Forms Apps by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Learn how to add Xamarin.Forms.Maps to your app and use maps in your Xamarin.Forms app! In this video we will see how to add a map to your iOS and Android app. We will add permissions, API keys and all the things that are needed to show that map on screen.

I know there were request for other things with maps, let me know in the comments what you'd like to see next!

[**Setup Maps in Your Xamarin.Forms Apps**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rgOwa7TQvIU) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

items.title: Real-World DevOps on the MAUI Team - Episode 144
items.description:
On today's episode of the podcast, Jeffrey Palermo is joined by two special guests, Alex Blount and Sweekriti Satpathy who discuss real-world DevOps on the MAUI team, how to get up and running with MAUI, a rundown of the products that the team uses (and how they're configured), and much more.

Azure DevOps Podcast: Real-World DevOps on the MAUI Team - Episode 144 by Azure DevOps Podcast
items.description_markdown:
On today's episode of the podcast, Jeffrey Palermo is joined by two special guests, Alex Blount and Sweekriti Satpathy who discuss real-world DevOps on the MAUI team, how to get up and running with MAUI, a rundown of the products that the team uses (and how they're configured), and much more. 

[**Azure DevOps Podcast: Real-World DevOps on the MAUI Team - Episode 144**](http://azuredevopspodcast.clear-measure.com/real-world-devops-on-the-maui-team-episode-144) by [Azure DevOps Podcast](http://azuredevopspodcast.clear-measure.com/)

embedded_links.title: **Azure DevOps Podcast: Real-World DevOps on the MAUI Team - Episode 144**

items.title: Null Pointers 56: Fonts and Icons
items.description:
You have your app idea; you got a picture of the design, even found that gradient. But don't stop there. What about your fonts and icons? In this episode, we talk about fonts, icons, where you can get them and what to look out for.

56: Fonts and Icons by Null Pointers
items.description_markdown:
You have your app idea; you got a picture of the design, even found that gradient. But don't stop there. What about your fonts and icons? In this episode, we talk about fonts, icons, where you can get them and what to look out for.

[**56: Fonts and Icons**](https://nullpointers.io/56/) by [Null Pointers](https://nullpointers.io/)
